str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To take along as a companion. From sun and paralambano; to take along in company.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
